segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine, and it's the start of a very new year, so we have some interesting vocabulary for you today about the new year.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，新的年份开始了，所以我们今天有一些关于新年的有趣词汇。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, we are starting a new year.
segments.cn: 所以，我们开始了新的一年。

segments.en: Why don't we just jump right into this dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们直接进入对话吧。

segments.en: Let's see what's going on, and we'll be back in a bit.
segments.cn: 让我们看看发生了什么，稍后再回来。

segments.en: It's almost midnight.
segments.cn: 快到午夜了。

segments.en: We're about to start a brand new year.
segments.cn: 我们即将开始崭新的一年。

segments.en: I know, it's so exciting.
segments.cn: 我知道，太令人兴奋了。

segments.en: A new year is always like a clean slate.
segments.cn: 新年总是像一张白纸。

segments.en: A fresh start to accomplish any dreams, objectives, and goals.
segments.cn: 一个新的开始，实现任何梦想、目标和计划。

segments.en: Do you have a new year's resolution?
segments.cn: 你有新年决心吗？

segments.en: I was thinking about it, but I'm never able to keep my new year's resolutions.
segments.cn: 我在考虑，但我从来无法坚持我的新年决心。

segments.en: Last year, for example, I joined a gym and only went twice.
segments.cn: 比如去年，我加入了健身房，只去了两次。

segments.en: Yeah, I know what you mean.
segments.cn: 是的，我知道你的意思。

segments.en: That's why this year I am keeping things more simple.
segments.cn: 所以今年我会简单一点。

segments.en: Maybe like getting together with friends I haven't seen in a long time, or doing some volunteering work.
segments.cn: 也许是和很久没见的朋友聚会，或者做一些志愿者工作。

segments.en: That seems reasonable.
segments.cn: 听起来合理。

segments.en: We should get together and watch the ball drop in Times Square.
segments.cn: 我们应该聚在一起看时代广场的倒计时。

segments.en: Sure, as long as you don't try to kiss me at midnight.
segments.cn: 当然，只要你不在午夜亲吻我。

segments.en: Well, we can't break tradition.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们不能打破传统。

segments.en: It's bad luck!
segments.cn: 这会带来厄运！

segments.en: Alright, so we've prepared a couple of different words for you on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们为你准备了一些不同的词汇作为语言收获。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言收获。

segments.en: Alright, the first word we have is actually a phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，第一个词实际上是一个短语。

segments.en: We have this phrase, brand new.
segments.cn: 我们有这个短语，崭新。

segments.en: Something is a brand new thing.
segments.cn: 某物是崭新的。

segments.en: That's right, we said that we are starting a brand new year.
segments.cn: 没错，我们说我们开始了崭新的一年。

segments.en: And that's just another way of saying completely new.
segments.cn: 这只是说完全新的另一种方式。

segments.en: So, I want a brand new bicycle.
segments.cn: 所以，我想要一辆崭新的自行车。

segments.en: It means I want a new bicycle from the store, not one from the garage.
segments.cn: 这意味着我想要一辆商店里的新自行车，而不是车库里的。

segments.en: That's right, so it's something completely new, never been used.
segments.cn: 没错，所以这是完全新的，从未使用过。

segments.en: So we're starting a brand new year and we're saying it's exciting because it's a great opportunity like having a clean slate.
segments.cn: 所以我们开始了崭新的一年，我们说这令人兴奋，因为这是一个像白纸一样的好机会。

segments.en: So a clean slate.
segments.cn: 所以一张白纸。

segments.en: Now this is an interesting phrase because you might not know what a slate is.
segments.cn: 现在这是一个有趣的短语，因为你可能不知道白板是什么。

segments.en: But basically it means that you start from the very beginning.
segments.cn: 但基本上它意味着你从头开始。

segments.en: So there's no history, there's nothing that you have to worry about.
segments.cn: 所以没有历史，没有你需要担心的事情。

segments.en: You start completely new.
segments.cn: 你完全是新的开始。

segments.en: That's a clean slate.
segments.cn: 这就是一张白纸。

segments.en: That's right, so just imagine you're in class and you have the whiteboard or the chalkboard.
segments.cn: 没错，所以想象一下你在课堂上，有白板或黑板。

segments.en: And you just erase everything and then you start again.
segments.cn: 你把所有东西都擦掉，然后重新开始。

segments.en: That's kind of what it means to have a clean slate, a new start.
segments.cn: 这就是拥有一张白纸、新开始的意思。

segments.en: Exactly, and so we have a clean slate, we need to talk about what we will do with the clean slate.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以我们有一张白纸，我们需要讨论我们将如何利用这张白纸。

segments.en: And so one person asks the other, do you have any new year's resolutions?
segments.cn: 所以一个人问另一个人，你有新年决心吗？

segments.en: That's right, so this is one of the most popular things during the new year's is people make a new year's resolution.
segments.cn: 没错，所以在新年期间最流行的事情之一就是人们制定新年决心。

segments.en: So a resolution is something that you have decided you will do.
segments.cn: 所以决心是你决定要做的事情。

segments.en: I have many resolutions.
segments.cn: 我有很多决心。

segments.en: I will learn to play the piano this year.
segments.cn: 今年我会学习弹钢琴。

segments.en: So in the new year I will do this thing.
segments.cn: 所以在新年我会做这件事。

segments.en: That's right, so it's basically like a promise, something that you promise yourself that you will do in the new year.
segments.cn: 没错，所以这基本上就像一个承诺，承诺自己在新年要做的事情。

segments.en: So as you say, maybe start playing the piano.
segments.cn: 所以你说，也许开始弹钢琴。

segments.en: That's right, so we call that a resolution or if we want to be specific we call it a new year's resolution.
segments.cn: 没错，所以我们称之为决心，或者如果我们想具体一点，我们称之为新年决心。

segments.en: Now at the very end of the dialogue we heard another phrase, this is quite strange.
segments.cn: 现在在对话的最后，我们听到了另一个短语，这很奇怪。

segments.en: They want to kiss at midnight and the one person says, well, we can't break tradition.
segments.cn: 他们想在午夜亲吻，而一个人说，嗯，我们不能打破传统。

segments.en: That's right, to break a tradition or to break tradition.
segments.cn: 没错，打破传统或打破传统。

segments.en: And that basically means to not do something that we usually do.
segments.cn: 这基本上意味着不做我们通常会做的事情。

segments.en: All right, so you can follow tradition.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你可以遵循传统。

segments.en: That means that you do the same thing maybe every year.
segments.cn: 这意味着你每年可能都做同样的事情。

segments.en: But if you break tradition that means you don't do what you are expected to do.
segments.cn: 但如果你打破传统，那就意味着你不做你被期望做的事情。

segments.en: So remember that verb is to break, break tradition.
segments.cn: 所以记住那个动词是打破，打破传统。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: All right, so let's review this vocab.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们复习一下这些词汇。

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue again.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍对话。

segments.en: It's almost midnight.
segments.cn: 快到午夜了。

segments.en: We're about to start a brand new year.
segments.cn: 我们即将开始崭新的一年。

segments.en: I know, it's so exciting.
segments.cn: 我知道，太令人兴奋了。

segments.en: A new year is always like a clean slate.
segments.cn: 新年总是像一张白纸。

segments.en: A fresh start to accomplish any dreams, objectives and goals.
segments.cn: 一个新的开始，实现任何梦想、目标和计划。

segments.en: Do you have a new year's resolution?
segments.cn: 你有新年决心吗？

segments.en: I was thinking about it, but I'm never able to keep my new year's resolutions.
segments.cn: 我在考虑，但我从来无法坚持我的新年决心。

segments.en: Last year, for example, I joined a gym and only went twice.
segments.cn: 比如去年，我加入了健身房，只去了两次。

segments.en: Yeah, I know what you mean.
segments.cn: 是的，我知道你的意思。

segments.en: That's why this year I am keeping things more simple.
segments.cn: 所以今年我会简单一点。

segments.en: Maybe like getting together with friends I haven't seen in a long time or doing some volunteering work.
segments.cn: 也许是和很久没见的朋友聚会，或者做一些志愿者工作。

segments.en: That seems reasonable.
segments.cn: 听起来合理。

segments.en: We should get together and watch the ball drop in Times Square.
segments.cn: 我们应该聚在一起看时代广场的倒计时。

segments.en: Sure, as long as you don't try to kiss me at midnight.
segments.cn: 当然，只要你不在午夜亲吻我。

segments.en: Well, we can't break tradition.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们不能打破传统。

segments.en: It's bad luck.
segments.cn: 这会带来厄运。

segments.en: All right, so let's take a look at those phrases now on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在让我们看看这些短语在流利度提升器上的表现。

segments.en: So there's a phrase in here that I use all the time.
segments.cn: 这里有一个我一直使用的短语。

segments.en: We heard about this resolution to go to the gym more often.
segments.cn: 我们听到了这个决心，去健身房更频繁。

segments.en: And the person said, you know, I never really go to the gym.
segments.cn: 那个人说，你知道，我从来不去健身房。

segments.en: And the other said, you know, I know what you mean.
segments.cn: 另一个人说，你知道，我知道你的意思。

segments.en: Yeah, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: She says, yeah, I know what you mean.
segments.cn: 她说，是的，我知道你的意思。

segments.en: And so basically we use this when you agree with the person, you understand what they are saying.
segments.cn: 所以基本上我们在同意对方时使用这个短语，你理解他们在说什么。

segments.en: Yeah, it's almost like saying I had the same experience.
segments.cn: 是的，这几乎就像说我有同样的经历。

segments.en: So maybe I also belong to a gym and I never go to that gym, just like you.
segments.cn: 所以也许我也属于一个健身房，我从来不去那个健身房，就像你一样。

segments.en: So it means I know what you mean.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着我知道你的意思。

segments.en: I have the same problem.
segments.cn: 我有同样的问题。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you can just agree with someone, completely agree with someone by saying, yeah, I know what you mean or I know what you mean.
segments.cn: 所以你可以通过说，是的，我知道你的意思，完全同意某人。

segments.en: I know what you mean.
segments.cn: 我知道你的意思。

segments.en: All right, so, well, this year we want to keep things a little bit more simple.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以，今年我们想保持事情简单一点。

segments.en: And we said, well, maybe like getting together with friends I haven't seen in a long time.
segments.cn: 我们说，嗯，也许是和很久没见的朋友聚会。

segments.en: All right, so think about this.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以想想这个。

segments.en: To get together with friends.
segments.cn: 和朋友聚会。

segments.en: Lots of words there, but you can see friends.
segments.cn: 词汇很多，但你可以看到朋友。

segments.en: But to get together means to be social with, to hang out with, to do things together.
segments.cn: 但聚会意味着社交、闲逛、一起做事情。

segments.en: But it's not very specific.
segments.cn: 但这并不具体。

segments.en: It's a nice way to say just to be with your friends.
segments.cn: 这是一种说法，就是和朋友在一起。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So maybe you are going with your friends out.
segments.cn: 所以也许你和朋友一起出去。

segments.en: Maybe shopping, maybe to the movies.
segments.cn: 也许是购物，或者去看电影。

segments.en: So you say, yeah, I'm going to get together with my friends later on this afternoon.
segments.cn: 所以你说，是的，我今天下午要和朋友聚会。

segments.en: All right, so we can get together with friends as a resolution.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们可以把和朋友聚会作为一个决心。

segments.en: That's something we want to do in the near future.
segments.cn: 这是我们想在不久的将来做的事情。

segments.en: But for now we're going to get together and watch the ball drop in Times Square.
segments.cn: 但现在我们要一起看时代广场的降球。

segments.en: That's the New Year's plan.
segments.cn: 这就是新年计划。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So it may seem strange.
segments.cn: 所以这可能看起来很奇怪。

segments.en: It's not actually a phrasal verb or a colloquial phrase.
segments.cn: 这实际上不是一个短语动词或口语表达。

segments.en: There is actually a ball that goes down as the countdown begins to midnight.
segments.cn: 实际上有一个球在倒计时到午夜时下降。

segments.en: And once it completely disappears, then you celebrate the New Year.
segments.cn: 一旦它完全消失，你就庆祝新年。

segments.en: So you actually see this big round ball coming down in Times Square.
segments.cn: 所以你实际上会看到这个大圆球在时代广场下降。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a way to count down to the New Year.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一种倒计时迎接新年的方式。

segments.en: So people often say ten, nine, eight, seven to the countdown.
segments.cn: 所以人们通常会说十、九、八、七来倒计时。

segments.en: And the ball will drop, and that means it's the New Year.
segments.cn: 然后球会下降，这意味着新年到了。

segments.en: So this is something that we refer to.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们提到的事情。

segments.en: It's something we talk about when we want to discuss the New Year.
segments.cn: 这是我们在讨论新年时会谈到的事情。

segments.en: So we'll watch the ball drop together.
segments.cn: 所以我们会一起看球降。

segments.en: It's an event.
segments.cn: 这是一个活动。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so a lot of great stuff there.
segments.cn: 好的，这里有很多精彩的内容。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to the dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 我们再听一次对话吧。

segments.en: It's almost midnight.
segments.cn: 快到午夜了。

segments.en: We're about to start a brand new year.
segments.cn: 我们即将开始一个全新的年。

segments.en: I know, it's so exciting.
segments.cn: 我知道，这太令人兴奋了。

segments.en: A new year is always like a clean slate.
segments.cn: 新年总是像一张白纸。

segments.en: A fresh start to accomplish any dreams, objectives, and goals.
segments.cn: 一个新的开始，实现任何梦想、目标和计划。

segments.en: Do you have a New Year's resolution?
segments.cn: 你有新年决心吗？

segments.en: I was thinking about it, but I'm never able to keep my New Year's resolutions.
segments.cn: 我在考虑，但我从来无法坚持我的新年决心。

segments.en: Last year, for example, I joined a gym and only went twice.
segments.cn: 例如，去年我加入了健身房，只去了两次。

segments.en: Yeah, I know what you mean.
segments.cn: 是的，我知道你的意思。

segments.en: That's why this year I am keeping things more simple.
segments.cn: 所以今年我让事情简单一点。

segments.en: Maybe like getting together with friends I haven't seen in a long time, or doing some volunteering work.
segments.cn: 也许是和很久没见的朋友聚会，或者做一些志愿工作。

segments.en: That seems reasonable.
segments.cn: 这听起来合理。

segments.en: We should get together and watch the ball drop in Times Square.
segments.cn: 我们应该聚在一起，看时代广场的降球。

segments.en: Sure, as long as you don't try to kiss me at midnight.
segments.cn: 当然，只要你在午夜时不要试图吻我。

segments.en: Well, we can't break tradition.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们不能打破传统。

segments.en: It's bad luck.
segments.cn: 这是不吉利的。

segments.en: Alright, so talking about New Year's, everyone makes New Year's resolutions.
segments.cn: 好吧，谈到新年，每个人都会制定新年决心。

segments.en: And people get together to watch the ball drop in Times Square.
segments.cn: 人们聚在一起观看时代广场的降球。

segments.en: Now this is more of an American thing.
segments.cn: 这更像是美国的事情。

segments.en: Have you ever experienced anything different from New Year's?
segments.cn: 你有没有经历过与新年不同的事情？

segments.en: Some other type of tradition?
segments.cn: 其他类型的传统？

segments.en: Because also here, they kiss at midnight.
segments.cn: 因为在这里，他们在午夜时会亲吻。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Well, that's a pretty standard American tradition.
segments.cn: 嗯，这是一个相当标准的美国传统。

segments.en: People will get together and they'll have the TV on.
segments.cn: 人们会聚在一起，打开电视。

segments.en: They'll have a party or they'll be with friends.
segments.cn: 他们会开派对，或者和朋友在一起。

segments.en: And they will maybe watch some fireworks or watch the TV as the ball drops.
segments.cn: 他们可能会观看烟花，或者在球降时看电视。

segments.en: So I've done both.
segments.cn: 所以我都经历过。

segments.en: I've gone out.
segments.cn: 我出去过。

segments.en: Because sometimes you go outside, it's very cold, but you go to a bridge or a park or somewhere public where the city government or the state will have some kind of special fireworks display.
segments.cn: 因为有时你出去，天气很冷，但你会去桥上、公园或城市政府或州会有特别烟花表演的公共场所。

segments.en: So then everyone will watch the fireworks or watch a big TV screen and then when it's midnight, when it's the New Year, then everyone will kiss.
segments.cn: 所以大家会观看烟花，或者看大屏幕，然后在午夜时，新年到来时，大家会亲吻。

segments.en: So everyone will kiss maybe...
segments.cn: 所以大家会亲吻，也许...

segments.en: I mean, is it just between couples or whoever's available, you kiss whoever's there?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，这只是情侣之间，还是随便谁都可以亲吻？

segments.en: Sometimes it's whoever is available.
segments.cn: 有时是随便谁。

segments.en: That's happened to me.
segments.cn: 这发生在我身上。

segments.en: Where you turn around and you say, oh, hi, I don't know you.
segments.cn: 你转过身说，哦，嗨，我不认识你。

segments.en: So the tradition is you have to kiss someone at midnight.
segments.cn: 所以传统是你必须在午夜时亲吻某人。

segments.en: So this is for good luck?
segments.cn: 这是为了好运吗？

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: For good luck in the New Year?
segments.cn: 为了新年的好运？

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So if you don't kiss someone, then you're kind of breaking the tradition.
segments.cn: 所以如果你不亲吻某人，你就有点打破了传统。

segments.en: And it's unlucky.
segments.cn: 这是不吉利的。

segments.en: An interesting way of celebrating New Year's.
segments.cn: 一种有趣的庆祝新年的方式。

segments.en: This is, as we said, in the United States, watching the ball drop, kissing someone at midnight.
segments.cn: 这就是我们所说的，在美国，观看降球，在午夜亲吻某人。

segments.en: So we are really curious to know how you celebrate your New Year's in your country because maybe you have similar traditions or very different things.
segments.cn: 所以我们真的很想知道你在你的国家是如何庆祝新年的，因为也许你有类似的传统或非常不同的事情。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And I know some places like Italy even have special foods you are supposed to eat to bring wealth and prosperity in the New Year.
segments.cn: 我知道一些地方，比如意大利，甚至有特别的食物，你应该吃来带来财富和繁荣。

segments.en: So let us know.
segments.cn: 所以让我们知道。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Alright, we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。

segments.en: See you next time.
segments.cn: 下次见。
